intro: Gladiolus fungurumeensis, commonly known as the Fungurume gladiolus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its tall, sturdy stems and showy, colorful flowers. The plant typically produces spikes of vividly colored blooms in shades of red, yellow, and orange. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sunlight, making it a popular choice for gardens and floral arrangements. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated for both horticultural and commercial purposes.
